sentences.sContent: Coal consumption in Manchester was measured in millions of tonnes, and its smoke became, as Lewis Mumford remarked, "the very incense of the new industrialism".
sentences.sContent_eng: Coal consumption in Manchester was measured in millions of tonnes, and its smoke became, as Lewis Mumford remarked, "the very incense of the new industrialism".
sentences.sCn: 估计曼彻斯特消耗了数百万吨的煤炭，引用路易斯·芒福德的话说，这个城市上空飘着的烟“就是新工业主义的香气”。

words.tran: 工业的，产业的；从事工业的；供工业用的；来自勤劳的
实业家；工业家；产业工人
使工业化；将…组成产业（industrialize的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: the system by which a society gets its wealth through industries and machinery
